page.title: 18DERIVATION OF PLACE NAMES
page.content: {HAMSEY } Hammes-say: the home of the Say family. {OFFHAM } Off- Hamsey. {LEWES } From Old English{hlaew} meaning hills. { {COOKSBRIDGE} There is still a bridge in the village called Cook's Bridge though it only goes over a ditch nowadays. {EARWIG CORNER}The field here was once used to keep ewes while they were in lamb going up on to the Downs Ewe-wick became Earwig. {COW LEASE FARM}The rent for the farm was once paid in cows as the farmer did not have enough money. {PAY GATE COTTAGES} Where the toll for the turnpike was collected.
